# AIUR 2.2

## Important: Download information
To get the lastest release version of AIUR, please click [here](https://github.com/AIUR-group/AIUR/releases/latest).

To get the lastest commited code, please click either on the .tar.gz or .zip folder image above. **Warning**: The current code on the master branch can be unstable!

## Introduction
AIUR (Artificial Intelligence Using Randomness) is an AI for StarCraft: Brood War.

The main idea is to be unpredictable by making some stochastic choices. The AI starts a game with a "mood" randomly picked up among 5 moods, dictating some behaviors (aggressive, fast expand, macro-game, ...). In addition, some other choices (productions, timing attacks, early aggressions, ...) are also taken under random conditions.

Learning is an essential part of AIUR. For this, it uses persistent I/O files system to record which moods are efficient against a given opponent, in order to modify the probability distribution for the mood selection.  

## What's new since AIIDE/CIG 2013 (AIUR 2.1)?

  * New mood selection policy: AIUR uses now an epsilon-greedy algorithm.
  * New old mood: The DefensiveMood is selectable again at the beginning of a game (was disabled since AIUR v2.0). AIUR has thus 6 selectable starting moods.
  *  Rush mood changed into a rush DT.
  * Implement an off-line learning feature: You can now train AIUR against a given opponent and use that learning for further games, like during tournaments.
  * Improve the Cannon rush pathfinding. 

## Scientific papers

  * Santiago Ontañón, Gabriel Synnaeve, Alberto Uriarte, Florian Richoux, David Churchill and Mike Preuss. [A Survey of Real-Time Strategy Game AI Research and Competition in StarCraft](http://pagesperso.lina.univ-nantes.fr/~richoux-f/publications/tciaig13.pdf), Transactions on Computational Intelligence and AI in Games, IEEE, 2013.

## Competitions and ladders

AIUR participates to annual AIIDE and CIG tournaments since 2011, and is currently running on [krasi0's Broodwar bot ladder](http://bots-stats.krasi0.com) and on the [Student StarCraft AI Tournament](http://www.sscaitournament.com).

### Results:
#### 2014
  * [AIIDE 2014](http://webdocs.cs.ualberta.ca/~cdavid/starcraftaicomp/): coming soon
  * [CIG 2014](http://cilab.sejong.ac.kr/sc_competition/): coming soon 

#### 2013
  * [AIIDE 2013](http://webdocs.cs.ualberta.ca/~cdavid/starcraftaicomp/report2013.shtml): 3rd
  * [CIG 2013](http://ls11-www.cs.uni-dortmund.de/rts-competition/starcraft-cig2013) (no I/O systems): 3rd 

#### 2012
  * [AIIDE 2012](http://webdocs.cs.ualberta.ca/~cdavid/starcraftaicomp/index.shtml): 2nd
  * [CIG 2012](http://ls11-www.cs.uni-dortmund.de/rts-competition/starcraft-cig2012) (no I/O systems): 3rd

#### 2011
(no I/O systems in 2011)
  * [AIIDE 2011](http://skatgame.net/mburo/sc2011/): 3rd
  * [CIG 2011](http://ls11-www.cs.uni-dortmund.de/rts-competition/starcraft-cig2011): 5th
